edge: Set in 1970 and 1971
Cuarón's semi-autobiographical take on his upbringing

Who also produced, shot, and co-edited it

International co-production between Mexico and the United States
Roma received a number of accolades, including winning Best Foreign Language Film at the 91st Academy Awards.
Roma won Best Director for Alfonso Cuarón, making him the first foreign-language film director to win this category.
Cleodegaria 'Cleo' Gutiérrez is a Mixtec live-in maid in an upper-middle-class household located in Mexico City's Colonia Roma neighborhood.
The household consists of Sofía and her husband Antonio.
Sofía's mother, Teresa, is also part of the household.
The household also includes Sofía and Antonio's four school-aged children: Pepe, Sofi, Toño, and Paco.
Antonio often leaves for business conferences.
Sofía's distressed reactions to his absences suggest Antonio is having an extramarital affair.
Fermín initially pretends to be supportive of Cleo's pregnancy but later denies the baby is his and threatens her.
Sofía provides emotional comfort for Cleo when she reveals her pregnancy.
Cleo travels to an impoverished district on the edge of the city to find Fermín, who is training at a military-style camp run by Professor Zovek.
Antonio flirts with a young woman on the street in the context.

Militant group, Los Halcones (The Hawks), attacks student protest outside store, resulting in murder of a student who chases into the store. Cleo and Teresa witness this violence as they are shopping downtown.
Cleo's water breaks, resulting in the stillbirth of her baby girl due to complications during childbirth.
Sofía tells her children that she and their father are separating, as they go on a family holiday to the beaches at Tuxpan.
A strong current almost drowns Sofi and Paco while the group is at the beach in Tuxpan, but Cleo saves them despite not knowing how to swim.
Antonio briefly appears and reassures Cleo before leaving during her delivery of stillborn baby girl.
The house is reorganized after Sofía and the children return home from their family holiday to the beaches at Tuxpan, and Cleo prepares a load of clothes for washing.

On November 1, 2016, the crew of Roma was targeted by a robbery.
According to the studio, two women were hit during the robbery at Roma.
Five crew members of Roma were hospitalized due to the robbery.
These items were stolen during the robbery at Roma.
According to the studio, a group of city workers approached the crew at Roma and tried to shut down filming.
The crew reportedly arrived at Roma when a group of city workers approached them and tried to shut down filming.
The crew of Roma was targeted by the robbery.
It was announced in April 2018 that Netflix acquired the distribution rights for Roma.
Scott Stuber, the Netflix movie chief, acquired the distribution rights based on 12 minutes of footage he was shown.
A teaser trailer was released for the film.
The teaser trailer for the film was released on July 25, 2018.
The film had its world premiere at the Venice International Film Festival on August 30, 2018.
The next day after its world premiere at the Venice International Film Festival, the film made its North American debut at the Telluride Film Festival.
The film also played at the Toronto International Film Festival.
The film screened at the San Sebastián International Film Festival on September 27, 2018.
It screened at the New York Film Festival on October 5, 2018.
The film was released at independent theatres in Mexico on November 21, 2018.

node_2: refused to screen roma due to netflix's policies
edge: However, the Cinépolis and Cinemex chains refused to screen Roma in their theaters because of Netflix's policy that requires a longer exclusivity window than what they offer.
The film was released digitally on December 14, 2018.

node_2: refused to screen roma due to netflix's policies
edge: Both AMC Theatres and Regal Cinemas refused to screen Roma as part of their annual Best Picture showcase because they did not receive a license from Netflix to screen the film in their theaters.
The film's eligibility for the Academy Awards was a matter of controversy, since despite its limited theatrical release, many believed it to have been made for home viewing.
Steven Spielberg expressed disapproval of streaming films being eligible for Academy Awards
Many believed that Roma, despite its limited theatrical release, should be eligible for Academy Awards due to controversy surrounding streaming films being eligible.
The film received the biggest promotional campaign in Netflix's history with a $25 million advertisement budget, as stated by Netflix itself.
A consultant stated that the shipping charges for sending out thousands of six-pound Roma coffee table books to awards voters cost more than some movies' advertising budgets.
Netflix released Roma on December 14, 2018.
Sources deduced that Roma made approximately $90,000–120,000 from three theaters in its opening weekend.
Had the results of Roma been officially reported, its approximate venue average of $66,600 would have ranked among the best ever for a foreign-language film.
In its second weekend of theatrical release, Roma expanded to 17 theaters and grossed an estimated $110,000 from four of them.
Following the announcement of Roma's 10 Oscar nominations, it grossed another $175,000 from around 80 theaters, pushing it past $3 million.
Despite being released on Netflix, Roma expanded to 145 theaters and grossed an estimated $362,000 for a four-week total of $1.4 million.
Sources deduced that Roma made approximately $200,000 over the five-day Thanksgiving frame.
Roma is the most powerfully personal story of Alfonso Cuarón's career, as mentioned in the critical consensus on Rotten Tomatoes.
On review aggregator Rotten Tomatoes, Roma holds an approval rating of 96% based on 409 reviews.

The critical consensus on Rotten Tomatoes for Roma reads, 'Roma finds writer-director Alfonso Cuarón in complete, enthralling command of his visual craft--and telling the most powerfully personal story of his career.'

In The Guardian, Peter Bradshaw wrote: 'Roma is thrilling, engrossing, moving--and just entirely amazing, an adjectival pileup of wonder. He has reached back into his own childhood to create an intensely personal story.'

Manohla Dargis of The New York Times called the film 'an expansive, emotional portrait of life buffeted by violent forces, and a masterpiece' and praised Cuarón's use of 'intimacy and monumentality to express the depths of ordinary life'.

Slavoj Žižek argued that people were appreciating Cleo for the wrong reasons, claiming that people were appreciating her grace without seeing how she must break free from the moral constraints placed upon her.

node_2: golden lion for best film at venice international film festival
edge: Roma won the prestigious Golden Lion award at the Venice International Film Festival, adding to its growing list of accolades.
Roma received a highly coveted Best Picture nomination at the Academy Awards, making it the first film distributed primarily by a streaming service to earn this recognition.

node_2: most oscar nominations for a non-english language film
edge: With 10 nominations at the 91st Academy Awards, Roma tied with Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon (2000) for the most Oscar nominations received by a film not in English.
In a historic win, Roma took home the coveted Best Foreign Language Film award at the Academy Awards, making it the first Mexican film to receive this honor.
Roma's portrayal of Cleo, a main Indigenous character, is notable for its level of detail that goes beyond typical stereotypical depictions.

According to Gonzalez Rodriguez, Cleo's portrayal in Roma is an example of syntonic indigeneity, which challenges traditional representations of Indigenous characters as exotic figures (histrionic indigeneity).
In 2018, Roma received the AFI Special Award from the American Film Institute, as it was not eligible for their Movies of the Year due to its foreign-language status.
In 2018, Roma was named the best film of the year by both Time magazine and the New York Film Critics Circle.

node_2: one of the ten best films of 2018
edge: In late 2018, the National Board of Review named Roma one of the ten best films of the year.
In November 2019, it was confirmed that Roma would be released on DVD and Blu-ray by The Criterion Collection.
Roma is a Netflix original film.
In November 2019, it was confirmed that Roma would be added to the library of The Criterion Collection.
In February 2020, Netflix released a behind-the-scenes documentary called Road to Roma.
